intro: Primula stuartii var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features broad, heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant splash of color to its natural surroundings.
